metadata.title: CVE-2023-4132 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the siano smsusb module in theLinux kernel. The bug occurs during device initialization when the sianodevice is plugged in. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system,causing a denial of service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
